Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; single added red band above two added white bands; below, top of possible zigzag pattern in red and white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hound to left (neck, chest with red, shoulder and foreleg remaining; collar with black blobs between parallel lines); on left, outline of undetermined motif; below, two brown bands above part of guilloche pattern on cul.
Curator's comments: Hounds are very rarely depicted on vessels of the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 260, no. 505, pl. 67.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0551) (phase 2)
